        public boolean isZoomed()

        Returns:

      • setMaxZoom

        public void setMaxZoom(float max)
        Set the max zoom multiplier. Default value: 3.

      • getCurrentZoom

        public float getCurrentZoom()
        Get the current zoom. This is the zoom relative to the initial scale, not the original resource.
        Returns:
        current zoom multiplier.

      • setMinZoom

        public void setMinZoom(float min)
        Set the min zoom multiplier. Default value: 1.
        Parameters:
        min - min zoom multiplier.

      • resetZoom

        public void resetZoom()
        Reset zoom and translation to initial state.

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(float scale)
        Set zoom to the specified scale. Image will be centered by default.
        Parameters:
        scale -

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(float scale,
                    float focusX,
                    float focusY)
        Set zoom to the specified scale. Image will be centered around the point (focusX, focusY). These floats range from 0 to 1 and denote the focus point as a fraction from the left and top of the view. For example, the top left corner of the image would be (0, 0). And the bottom right corner would be (1, 1).
        Parameters:
        scale -
        focusX -
        focusY -

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(float scale,
                    float focusX,
                    float focusY,
                    ScaleType scaleType)
        Set zoom to the specified scale. Image will be centered around the point (focusX, focusY). These floats range from 0 to 1 and denote the focus point as a fraction from the left and top of the view. For example, the top left corner of the image would be (0, 0). And the bottom right corner would be (1, 1).
        Parameters:
        scale -
        focusX -
        focusY -
        scaleType -

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(TouchImageView img)
        Set zoom parameters equal to another TouchImageView. Including scale, position, and ScaleType.

      • getScrollPosition

        public android.graphics.PointF getScrollPosition()
        Return the point at the center of the zoomed image. The PointF coordinates range in value between 0 and 1 and the focus point is denoted as a fraction from the left and top of the view. For example, the top left corner of the image would be (0, 0). And the bottom right corner would be (1, 1).
        Returns:
        PointF representing the scroll position of the zoomed image.

      • setScrollPosition

        public void setScrollPosition(float focusX,
                              float focusY)
        Set the focus point of the zoomed image. The focus points are denoted as a fraction from the left and top of the view. The focus points can range in value between 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        focusX -
        focusY -
